intro: Chaenanthe barkeri, commonly known as the Barker's chaenanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asparagaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in spring. It is a compact, evergreen perennial that is well-suited for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
